duck: Material conditional, in propositional calculus, or logical calculus in mathematics
Conditional sentence, a sentence type used to refer to hypothetical situations and their consequences
Causal conditional, if X then Y, where X is a cause of Y
Conditional proof, in logic: a proof that asserts a conditional, and proves that the antecedent leads to the consequent
conditional definition: subject to, implying, or dependent upon a condition.
Conditional probability, the probability of an event A given that another event B has occurred
Conditional (programming), a statement or expression in computer programming languages
Strict conditional, as used in philosophy, logic, and mathematics

milestones: Alitalia conditionally accepts joint bid by Air France and KLM
NFL: Brett Favre traded to the New York Jets
Former Taiwanese President Chen Shui-bian released on bail
Israeli-American activist arrested for entering Gaza Strip

Wikileaks founder Julian Assange granted bail, set free
Iran stands defiant on Uranium enrichment
NZ Government passes bill to legalise controversial electioneering overspending
Australian Football League: Clubs threaten to take home games interstate
Self-Defence party to stay on in the governing coalition of Poland
Third of Thais vote 'none of the above'
Frenchman climbs skyscraper in 20 minutes without any equipment
Formula One teams to set up breakaway championship
Australian government announces $52.5 million financial assistance package for Ford
UK mother cleared of attempted murder of ME-suffering daughter
Australian PM mobbed by anti-Israel protesters
Danish Elections have endorsed the current Centre-Right Coalition
More arrests from Cronulla riots
UK seeks pardon for executed World War I soldiers

wiki.text:
'Conditional' may refer to:

*Causal conditional, if X then Y, where X is a cause of Y *Conditional
probability, the probability of an event A given that another event B has
occurred *Conditional proof, in logic: a proof that asserts a conditional, and
proves that the antecedent leads to the consequent *Strict conditional, as used
in philosophy, logic, and mathematics *Material conditional, in propositional
calculus, or logical calculus in mathematics *Relevance conditional, in
relevance logic *Conditional (programming), a statement or expression in
computer programming languages *A conditional expression in computer programming
languages such as *Conditions in a contract

In grammar and linguistics: *Conditional mood (or conditional tense), a verb
form in many languages *Conditional sentence, a sentence type used to refer to
hypothetical situations and their consequences **Indicative conditional, a
conditional sentence expressing "if A then B" in a natural language
**Counterfactual conditional, a conditional sentence indicating what would be
the case if its antecedent were true
wiki.title: conditional
